intro: Ilysanthes wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilmsii ilysanthes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has hairy, broad leaves. Its flowers are often pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
